edu.towson.cis.cosc455.ftchen.project1.interfaces

Interface LexicalAnalyzer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MyLexicalAnalyzer

    public interface LexicalAnalyzer
    COSC 455 Programming Languages: Implementation and Design. A Simple Lexical Analyzer adapted from Sebesta (2010) by Josh Dehlinger, modified by Adam Conover (2012) and interfaced by Josh Dehlinger (2013) Note that these are not the only methods necessary to implement the lexical analyzer. You will likely need to add new methods to your implementaion of this interface.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int currentPosition
      The current position.
      static java.lang.String nextCharacter
      The next character.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCharacter()
      This method adds the current character the nextToken.
      void getCharacter()
      This is method gets the next character from the input and places it in the nextCharacter class variable.
      void getNextToken()
      This is the public method to be called when the Syntax Analyzer needs a new token to be parsed.
      boolean isSpace(java.lang.String c)
      This is method gets the next character from the input and places it in the nextCharacter class variable.
      boolean lookupToken()
      This method checks to see if the current, possible token is legal in the defined grammar.

      • isSpace

        boolean isSpace(java.lang.String c)
        This is method gets the next character from the input and places it in the nextCharacter class variable.
        Parameters:
        c - the current character
        Returns:
        true, if is space; otherwise false

      • lookupToken

        boolean lookupToken()
        This method checks to see if the current, possible token is legal in the defined grammar.
        Returns:
        true, if it is a legal token, otherwise false
